name: 王謹誠
objective: This course comprises four parts. Part.I are basics of numerical methods. Part.II is the application of solving parabolic equations. Part.III is the application of solving elliptic equations. Part 4 is the application of solving hyperbolic equations.
schedule:
Week 01 CFD basics and ANSYS Fluent Introduction
Week 02 Review of Advanced Numerical Analysis
Week 03 Basics of Numerical Methods
Week 04 Basics of Numerical Methods
Week 05 Basics of Numerical Methods
Week 06 Parabolic Equations 
Week 07 Parabolic Equations 
Week 08 Parabolic Equations 
Week 09 Midterm 
Week 10 Elliptic Equations
Week 11 Elliptic Equations
Week 12 Elliptic Equations
Week 13 Hyperbolic Equations 
Week 14 Hyperbolic Equations 
Week 15 Hyperbolic Equations 
Week 16 Application to Convection-Diffusion Equation 
Week 17 Application to Convection-Diffusion Equation 
Week 18 Final Exam
materials: Computational Fluid Mechanics and Heat Transfer, Richard H. Pletcher, John C. Tannehill, and Dale A. Anderson, 3rd Edition, CRC Press, 2011, ISBN 9781591690375.
